    10. 
            
            

            

                  lecture_progress = 100* (lectures_count.to_f/ lectures.size)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                else

    15. 
            
            

            

                testings = course.testings.includes(:questions)
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

            
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                responses_count, full_count_questions = passed_tests(testings)
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                if full_count_questions > 0
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19.

      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

            
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                current_progress = (test_progress + lecture_progress)/2
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                ach = course.achievements.find_by(user_id: current_user.id)
          
      27.

              def readed_lectures(lectures)
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                count = 0
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                readeds = Readed.where(user_id: current_user.id)
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40.

      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41.

      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42.

      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43.

      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44.

    45.

      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46.

              # current user's testing stats
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            1
            

            

              def passed_tests(testings)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                all_questions = []
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                full_count_questions = 0
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

            
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                testings.each do |t|
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  all_questions << t.questions
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  full_count_questions += all_current_answers(t)
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                all_questions.flatten!
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

            
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                responses_count = all_current_responses(all_questions)
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                return [responses_count, full_count_questions]
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

            
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              # amount of correct test answers from all testings

            1
            

            

              def all_current_answers(testing)
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                count = 0
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                questions = Question.includes(:answers).where(testing_id: testing.id)
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                questions.each do |q|
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  q.answers.each do |answer|
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                    if answer.isCorrect
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                      count += 1
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                return count
          
      76.

      77.

      79.

              def all_current_responses(questions)
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                responses = Response.where(user_id: current_user.id)
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                count = 0
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                questions.each do |q|
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  responses.each do |r|
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                    if (q.id == r.question_id && r.mark == 1)
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                      count +=1
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86.

      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87.

      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      89.

              def testing_progress(test)
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                # amount of correct responses / amount of correct answer
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                if user_signed_in?
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  responses = Response.where(user_id: current_user.id)
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                count_answers = 0
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                count_responses = 0
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                questions = test.questions
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                questions.each do |q|
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  count_answers += q.answers.where(isCorrect: true).size
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  if responses.present?
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                    responses.each do |r|
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                      if (q.id == r.question_id && r.mark == 1) && r.present?
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                        count_responses += 1
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                @result = (count_responses.to_f / count_answers) * 100
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                return @result
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

              end

      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                # The first argument to `can` is the action you are giving the user
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                # permission to do.
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                # If you pass :manage it will apply to every action. Other common actions
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                # here are :read, :create, :update and :destroy.
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                # The second argument is the resource the user can perform the action on.
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                # If you pass :all it will apply to every resource. Otherwise pass a Ruby
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                # class of the resource.
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                # The third argument is an optional hash of conditions to further filter the
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                # objects.
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                # For example, here the user can only update published articles.
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                #   can :update, Article, :published => true
          
      54.

                #
          
      55.

                # See the wiki for details:

                # https://github.com/CanCanCommunity/cancancan/wiki/Defining-Abilities

              # The secret key used by Devise. Devise uses this key to generate
          
      13.

              # random tokens. Changing this key will render invalid all existing
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              # confirmation, reset password and unlock tokens in the database.
          
      15.

      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              # by default. You can change it below and use your own secret key.
          
      17.

              # Configure which keys are used when authenticating a user. The default is
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

              # just :email. You can configure it to use [:username, :subdomain], so for
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

              # authenticating a user, both parameters are required. Remember that those
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

              # parameters are used only when authenticating and not when retrieving from
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

              # session. If you need permissions, you should implement that in a before filter.
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

              # You can also supply a hash where the value is a boolean determining whether
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              # or not authentication should be aborted when the value is not present.
          
      51.

      79.

      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81.

      91.

              # By default, Devise cleans up the CSRF token on authentication to
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

              # avoid CSRF token fixation attacks. This means that, when using AJAX
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

              # requests for sign in and sign up, you need to get a new CSRF token
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

              # from the server. You can disable this option at your own risk.
          
      108.

    110. 
            
            

            

              # When false, Devise will not attempt to reload routes on eager load.
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

              # This can reduce the time taken to boot the app but if your application
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

              # requires the Devise mappings to be loaded during boot time the application
          
      113.

              # ==> Configuration for :database_authenticatable
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

              # For bcrypt, this is the cost for hashing the password and defaults to 12. If
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

              # using other algorithms, it sets how many times you want the password to be hashed.
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

              # The number of stretches used for generating the hashed password are stored
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

              # with the hashed password. This allows you to change the stretches without
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

              # invalidating existing passwords.
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

              # Limiting the stretches to just one in testing will increase the performance of
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

              # your test suite dramatically. However, it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED to not use
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

              # a value less than 10 in other environments. Note that, for bcrypt (the default
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

              # algorithm), the cost increases exponentially with the number of stretches (e.g.
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

              # a value of 20 is already extremely slow: approx. 60 seconds for 1 calculation).
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            1
            

            

              config.stretches = Rails.env.test? ? 1 : 12
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

              # Set up a pepper to generate the hashed password.
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

              # rubocop:todo Layout/LineLength
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

              # config.pepper = 'a39893792e2553daf3f3d64e4ed88ee1f36b175bb5064a6b400d920208dfa5998cb0d4eead71d7326b7cbb06ef974b441b07078035306102a244c3e873c01a4b'

              # Send a notification email when the user's password is changed.

              # config.send_password_change_notification = false

    141. 
            
            

            

              # ==> Configuration for :confirmable
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

              # A period that the user is allowed to access the website even without
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

              # confirming their account. For instance, if set to 2.days, the user will be
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

              # able to access the website for two days without confirming their account,
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

              # access will be blocked just in the third day.
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

              # You can also set it to nil, which will allow the user to access the website
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

              # without confirming their account.
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

              # Default is 0.days, meaning the user cannot access the website without
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

              # confirming their account.
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

              # config.allow_unconfirmed_access_for = 2.days
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

            
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

              # A period that the user is allowed to confirm their account before their
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

              # token becomes invalid. For example, if set to 3.days, the user can confirm
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

              # their account within 3 days after the mail was sent, but on the fourth day
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

              # their account can't be confirmed with the token any more.
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

              # Default is nil, meaning there is no restriction on how long a user can take
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

              # before confirming their account.
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

              # config.confirm_within = 3.days
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

            
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

              # If true, requires any email changes to be confirmed (exactly the same way as
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

              # initial account confirmation) to be applied. Requires additional unconfirmed_email
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

              # db field (see migrations). Until confirmed, new email is stored in
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

              # unconfirmed_email column, and copied to email column on successful confirmation.
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            1
            

            

              config.reconfirmable = true
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

            
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

              # Defines which key will be used when confirming an account
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

              # config.confirmation_keys = [:email]
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

              # ==> Configuration for :rememberable
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

              # The time the user will be remembered without asking for credentials again.
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

              # config.remember_for = 2.weeks
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

            
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

              # Invalidates all the remember me tokens when the user signs out.

              # ==> Configuration for :lockable

              # Defines which strategy will be used to lock an account.

              # :failed_attempts = Locks an account after a number of failed attempts to sign in.

              # :email = Sends an unlock link to the user email

              # :both  = Enables both strategies

      211.

    100.0% lines covered

    245 relevant lines. 245 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            
            

            

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2.

            # Please do not make direct changes to this file!
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            # This generator is maintained by the community around simple_form-bootstrap:
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

            # https://github.com/rafaelfranca/simple_form-bootstrap

            # Dir[Rails.root.join('lib/components/**/*.rb')].each { |f| require f }

            # Use this setup block to configure all options available in SimpleForm.
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            1
            

            

            SimpleForm.setup do |config| # rubocop:todo Metrics/BlockLength
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

              # Default class for buttons
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            1
            

            

              config.button_class = 'btn'
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

            
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              # Define the default class of the input wrapper of the boolean input.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            1
            

            

              config.boolean_label_class = 'form-check-label'
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              # How the label text should be generated altogether with the required text.
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            1
            

            

              config.label_text = ->(label, required, _explicit_label) { "#{label} #{required}" }
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              # Define the way to render check boxes / radio buttons with labels.
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            1
            

            

              config.boolean_style = :inline
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

              # You can wrap each item in a collection of radio/check boxes with a tag
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            1
            

            

              config.item_wrapper_tag = :div
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              # Defines if the default input wrapper class should be included in radio
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

              # collection wrappers.
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            1
            

            

              config.include_default_input_wrapper_class = false
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36.

      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            1
            

            

              config.error_notification_class = 'alert alert-danger'
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

            
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

              # Method used to tidy up errors. Specify any Rails Array method.
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

              # :first lists the first message for each field.
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              # :to_sentence to list all errors for each field.
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            1
            

            

              config.error_method = :to_sentence
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

            
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

              # add validation classes to `input_field`
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            1
            

            

              config.input_field_error_class = 'is-invalid'
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            1
            

            

              config.input_field_valid_class = 'is-valid'
          
      47.

              # vertical default_wrapper
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            1
            

            

              config.wrappers :vertical_form, tag: 'div', class: 'form-group', error_class: 'form-group-invalid',
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                                              valid_class: 'form-group-valid' do |b|
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            1
            

            

                b.use :html5
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            1
            

            

                b.use :placeholder
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            1
            

            

                b.optional :maxlength
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            1
            

            

                b.optional :minlength
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            1

      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            1
            

            

                b.optional :min_max
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            1
            

            

                b.optional :readonly
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            1
            

            

                b.use :label, class: 'form-control-label'
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            1
            

            

                b.use :input, class: 'form-control', error_class: 'is-invalid', valid_class: 'is-valid'
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            1
            

            

                b.use :full_error, wrap_with: { tag: 'div', class: 'invalid-feedback' }
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            1
            

            

                b.use :hint, wrap_with: { tag: 'small', class: 'form-text text-muted' }
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      65.

                  it 'change name' do

            module ControllerMacros

              def login_user
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

                # Before each test, create and login the user
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                before(:each) do
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                  @request.env['devise.mapping'] = Devise.mappings[:user]
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                  role = FactoryBot.create(:role)
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                  course = FactoryBot.create(:course)
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                  testing = FactoryBot.create(:testing, course: course)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                  question = FactoryBot.create(:question, testing: testing)
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                  user = FactoryBot.create(:user, role: role)
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  # user.confirm! # Or set a confirmed_at inside the factory. Only necessary if you are using the "confirmable" module
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  sign_in user
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

            
          
      18.

              def set_course; end
